content:
Consider the following reaction between sodium chloride and silver nitrate:
NaCl(aq) + AgNO3(aq) → AgCl(s) + NaNO3(aq)
What is the balanced chemical equation for this reaction? Please provide the coefficients for each reactant and product.

The given chemical equation is already balanced. Each side of the reaction has an equal number of each type of atom. Here is the balanced equation with the coefficients explicitly shown:

\[ 1 \, \text{NaCl(aq)} + 1 \, \text{AgNO}_3\text{(aq)} \rightarrow 1 \, \text{AgCl(s)} + 1 \, \text{NaNO}_3\text{(aq)} \]

The coefficients are all 1, indicating that one mole of sodium chloride reacts with one mole of silver nitrate to produce one mole of silver chloride and one mole of sodium nitrate.
